channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A federal judge just dealt a blow to RFK Jr.’s strategy to defund Planned Parenthood
item.description: Planned Parenthood must keep getting Medicaid funds from the government as it fights attempts to cut off money for its health clinics.

item.title: Durbin Demands Tapes of Interviews With Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein’s Longtime Partner
item.description: The top Democrat on the Senate Judiciary Committee also pressed the Justice Department for a promise that Ms. Maxwell will not be pardoned for her coo...

item.title: Ryan Reynolds’ Maximum Effort ad agency turned Astronomer’s viral moment into marketing gold
item.description: The Oscar winner surprised everyone by speaking on behalf of the company following CEO scandal.

item.title: Sovereignty Is Having a Moment
item.description: We explain why leaders are talking so much about independence.

item.title: ‘Revenge Is Not a Policy’: Israelis Voice Dissent Against the War in Gaza
item.description: After a long silence, prominent Israelis and activists are increasingly raising alarms about potential war crimes being carried out by the government.

item.title: A Delta pilot was arrested on child sex abuse material charges after landing in San Francisco
item.description: Federal agents entered the cockpit once the plane landed and took him into custody.

item.title: Tampa Hits 100 Degrees for the First Time as Heat Grips the Southeast
item.description: Extreme heat has settled across much of the region.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia Agree to Halt Fighting That Has Killed Dozens
item.description: U.S.-backed talks to end the border war, in which militaries have killed dozens of people and displaced hundreds of thousands, began on Monday in Mala...

item.title: Warren Buffett’s longtime Social Security warning is coming to fruition, with retirees facing an $18,000 annual cut
item.description: The Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget projects that Social Security's main trust fund will be insolvent by the end of 2032, triggering automa...

item.title: Trump and JD Vance are on completely different continents right now and they’re still getting peppered with Epstein questions
item.description: Asked about the timing of the US-EU trade announcement and the Epstein case, Trump responded: “You got to be kidding with that."

item.title: Israel Returned to War in Gaza Hoping to Break Hamas. It Achieved Few, if Any, Goals.
item.description: Israel ended a truce in Gaza in March, hoping to break Hamas. The move has heightened suffering for Palestinians but achieved few, if any, Israeli goa...

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia Agree to Halt Fighting That Has Killed Dozens
item.description: U.S.-backed talks to end the border war, in which militaries have killed dozens of people and displaced hundreds of thousands, began on Monday in Mala...

item.title: Trump Administration Live Updates: President Disagrees With Netanyahu on Gaza and Moves Up Putin’s Deadline
item.description: President Trump disputed the Israeli prime minister’s claim that there is no starvation in Gaza, and called on Russia to end the war in Ukraine in les...

item.title: ‘Revenge Is Not a Policy’: Israelis Voice Dissent Against the War in Gaza
item.description: After a long silence, prominent Israelis and activists are increasingly raising alarms about potential war crimes being carried out by the government.

item.title: Tehran Is at Risk of Running Out of Water Within Weeks
item.description: After a five-year drought and decades of mismanagement, a water crisis is battering Iran.
